intro: Adenolobus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ranunculaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants typically have basal leaves and produce showy, yellow or white flowers with five petals. The genus is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and preference for moist, well-drained soils. Adenolobus species are often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where they contribute to local biodiversity.
